title: Kelly's Home - Rental and Vacant Periods During Absence

scenario_info.name: Home with Mixed Income-Producing and Vacant Periods
scenario_info.description: Same scenario as Example 1 except Kelly moved interstate on 1 April 2018 for 8 years. Initially, Kelly was on a one-year contract that kept getting extended. During the 8-year absence, the property was rented for some periods and vacant for others. Since the total income-producing period exceeds 6 years, partial exemption applies.
key_points: Kelly lived in the property from March 2015 to April 2018 (3 years 1 month)
Property was absent for 8 years (April 2018 to April 2026)
During absence: rented for 6.5 years, vacant for 1.5 years
Only the income-producing periods count toward the 6-year limit
Since rental period (6.5 years) exceeds 6 years, partial exemption applies
Vacant periods (non-income-producing) have unlimited absence period
applicable_rules: ITAA97 s118.145: Six-year absence rule (income-producing property)
ITAA97 s118.145(2): Unlimited absence if not income-producing (vacant periods)
Only income-producing periods count toward the 6-year limit
Vacant periods between rental periods don't break the absence
When 6-year limit exceeded, partial exemption calculated using time apportionment
ITAA97 s115.25: 50% CGT discount applies to taxable portion (owned > 12 months)

property_history.description: Moved in immediately - established as main residence
Moved interstate for work on one-year contract
Second rental period begins after 6 months vacant
Third rental period begins after 1 year vacant
Kelly finally returns after 8 years interstate

properties.notes: Complex scenario with mixed rental and vacant periods during 8-year absence. Total rental: ~6.5 years (exceeds 6-year limit by 6 months). Vacant periods: ~1.5 years. Partial exemption applies - only the portion exceeding 6 years of rental is taxable.

user_query: I moved interstate for 8 years. During that time my home was rented for about 6.5 years total and vacant for about 1.5 years between tenants. I moved back and then sold the property. What is my CGT position?
